ISSUE.TITLE: Camel case / As is in API
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **mysql2** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.11.46** Case of table fields is not honored. ![Screenshot 2021-10-15 at 15 50 39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/943152/137498163-d7dee1c8-485e-4d5d-a5df-31976632e80b.png) Calling API with curl produces the following result: [{"Id":1,"Name":"M0"},{"Id":2,"Name":"M1"},{"Id":3,"Name":"Mx"},{"Id":4,"Name":"M1a"},{"Id":5,"Name":"M1b"},{"Id":6,"Name":"M1c"}] **Expected behavior** field names should be lowercase.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: [test] cypress: test title corrections Signed-off-by: Raju Udava <sivadstala@gmail.com>

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Addressing #652 and #651: Camel case config flag for tables and columns This commit will add - NC_CAMELIZE_TABLE_NAMES - NC_CAMELIZE_COLUMN_NAMES flags to preserve original columns and tables names
Addressing #652 and #651: Camel case config flag for tables and columns This commit will add - NC_CAMELIZE_TABLE_NAMES - NC_CAMELIZE_COLUMN_NAMES flags to preserve original columns and tables names
